p: Nisin is a known antimicrobial agent and the only bacteriocins used as an additive to increase the shelf life of food in industries of >50 countries [ 6]. Combination of herbal EOs and extracts with nisin shows a synergistic effect on decreasing extracellular adenosine triphosphate in microorganisms [ 7]. On the other hand, the use of probiotics to enhance health and improve the digestive system has been proposed for decades. The probiotic bacteria (especially, different species of Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium) are known to possess antimicrobial activity, and therefore, they can be used to control and prevent the growth of spoilage bacteria and food-borne pathogens instead of chemical and synthetic preservatives [ 8].
